newsitem.title: INDIA: India cotton prices fall on poor overseas interest.
newsitem.headline: India cotton prices fall on poor overseas interest.

text.p: Indian cotton prices fell on Tuesday on low mill buying and poor overseas interest, dealers said.
Improved new crop arrivals also kept prices down, they said.
Daily arrivals in the Punjab region rose to 20,000/25,000 bales (170 kg each) against last week's supplies of 10,000/15,000 bales due to cold weather.

In spot deals Bengal-deshi slid by 10 rupees to 780/850 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned fell by 10 rupees to 1,410/1,610 rupees. F-414 slid by 5/15 rupees to 1,830/1,850 rupees per maund. Gujarat varieties on the other hand were steady in a narrow price band.
